he sees no reason why the military shouldn't be considered for spending cuts as lawmakers grapple with the ballooning deficit. Mr. Colin Powell pointed out that defense spending had at one time been cut 25%. I don't think the defense budget should be made sacrosanct, he said. The Obama administration has proposed cutting$ 78 billion from the military budget in the next five years.
